intro: Manilkariopsis rojasii, commonly known as the Mexican manilkara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a heavy, sticky resin that has been historically used by indigenous communities for various purposes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in lowland forests. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
